page.title: 04Employment (cont.)
page.content: Mining in Lochgelly ended in 1967 after almost 400 years of coal production. Unemployment in allied industries such as brickworks, a foundry and machine shop were also a result of pit closures. Most of the work-force in the area have to travel outwith the town. Rosyth Naval Dockyard and Electronic Industries, within a 22km radius,are major employers. Dunfermline District Council have established the Cartmore Estate to attract light industries. From the 1981 Census, the number of employed people in the Lochgelly North & South Districts was 3,700; 5% were unemployed.
